rules.ruleString: Unit was previously coded {ECM4430, ETC4430, ETC5443, ETX5443}

(Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECC2010} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS} and  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECC3410, ETC3400, ETC3410} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})
Must be enrolled in course type {03, 04, 05, 06, 09, 09-1, 09-4}

description: This course surveys contemporary macroeconometric and applied general equilibrium models as they are used for policy analysis. The focus of these models extends from fiscal, monetary and tax policy, through trade, tariffs and industry policy, to the environment and greenhouse gases. In their major written assignment, all students are expected to come to grips with some of the practical issues involved in policy modelling.
